meanings.definition: To look at or examine again
meanings.sent1: She relooked at her homework to make sure she didn't miss any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: He relooked at the map to find the correct route.
meanings.sent3: The detective relooked at the crime scene for any missed clues.
meanings.sent4: The teacher relooked at the students' essays with a critical eye.
meanings.sent5: The scientist relooked at the data to confirm the results.

meanings.definition: To consider or review something again
meanings.sent1: After the discussion, they relooked at the proposal to address the concerns.
meanings.sent2: The manager relooked at the budget to make necessary adjustments.
meanings.sent3: The team relooked at the project plan to ensure all aspects were covered.
meanings.sent4: She relooked at her decision before finalizing it.
meanings.sent5: The committee relooked at the policy for potential improvements.
